channel.title: Using Whonix Gateway with other OS's
channel.description:
Hello, I wasn't sure which forum to put this in.
I was wondering if there are any security concerns with using the gateway with a different OS VM other than the workstation. In other words, creating a new VM with a different Linux distro and configuring the network to pass traffic through the gateway.
Here is an example of what I mean: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl2yvfmP0zo
Will all the same security apply (difficult to discover host IP, malware with root privileges cant find IP, etc)?
I really like experimenting with different OS's and the gateway seems a good way to make everything flow through Tor. Are there any issues with doing this?

item.title: Using Whonix Gateway with other OS's
item.dc:creator: David888
item.description:
Thank you! Sorry, I missed those instructions. I was able to set it up in FreeBSD!

Do you know if the freebsd instructions would work for OpenBSD as well?

Read full topic
item.source: Using Whonix Gateway with other OS's

item.title: Using Whonix Gateway with other OS's
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi David888

Whonix

Other Operating Systems

Anonymize any Operating System! Your operating system tunneled through the Tor Anonymity Network! Create your Custom-Whonix-Workstation!
